6 from .enums import Object, ObjectColor, ObjectShape, Color2Threshold
7 from .markers import extract_img_markers
8 from .colors import hsv_threshold, most_present_color
9 from .contours import find_shape

12 class MarkersNotFoundError(Exception):
13  pass
14 
15 
16 class NoShapeFoundError(Exception):
17  pass
18 
19 
20 def detect_object(image: np.ndarray, color: ObjectColor, shape: ObjectShape,
21  workspace_ratio: float) -> Optional[Object]:
22  """
23  Detect an object in the image.
24  :param image: The image to process.
25  :param color: The color of the object to detect. If ObjectColor.ANY, the color will be determined after detection.
26  :param shape: The shape of the object to detect. If ObjectShape.ANY, the shape will be determined after detection.
27  :param workspace_ratio: The ratio of the workspace to use for detection. It should be between 0 and 1.
28  :return:
29  """
30  # Extract working area image from markers
31  im_work = extract_img_markers(image, workspace_ratio=workspace_ratio)
32  if im_work is None:
33  raise MarkersNotFoundError()
34 
35  # Get a black and white image of the image. white = wanted color, black = other colors
36  mask = hsv_threshold(im_work, Color2Threshold[color])
37 
38  # Find the biggest shape in the image
39  found_shape = find_shape(mask, shape)
40  if found_shape is None:
41  raise NoShapeFoundError()
42 
43  x, y, yaw, shape = found_shape
44 
45  # If we asked for any color, determine the color of the found object
46  if color == ObjectColor.ANY:
47  color = most_present_color(im_work, x, y)
48 
49  found_object = Object(shape=shape, color=color, x=x, y=y, yaw=yaw)
50  found_object.x = found_object.x / im_work.shape[1]
51  found_object.y = found_object.y / im_work.shape[0]
52 
53  return found_object
54 
55 
56 def __is_factor_significant(factor: float) -> bool:
57  """
58  Check if the factor is significant. A factor is considered significant if it has at least 0.1 difference from 1.0.
59  :param factor:
60  :return: True if the factor is significant, False otherwise.
61  """
62  return not np.isclose(factor, 1.0, rtol=0.01)
63 
64 
65 def post_process(image: np.ndarray,
66  brightness_factor: float,
67  contrast_factor: float,
68  saturation_factor: float,
69  dst: np.ndarray = None) -> np.ndarray:
70  """
71  Post-process the image to adjust brightness, contrast, and saturation.
72  :param image: The image to process
73  :param brightness_factor: The brightness factor to apply
74  :param contrast_factor: The contrast factor to apply
75  :param saturation_factor: The saturation factor to apply
76  :param dst: The destination image (optional)
77  :return: The processed image
78  """
79  if dst is None:
80  dst = image.copy()
81 
82  if __is_factor_significant(brightness_factor) or __is_factor_significant(contrast_factor):
83  # Adjust contrast and brightness
84  alpha = contrast_factor
85  beta = (brightness_factor - 1) * 255
86  cv2.addWeighted(dst, alpha, dst, 0, beta, dst)
87 
88  if __is_factor_significant(saturation_factor):
89  # Adjust saturation
90  cv2.cvtColor(dst, cv2.COLOR_BGR2HSV, dst=dst)
91  dst[..., 1] = cv2.multiply(dst[..., 1], saturation_factor)
92  cv2.cvtColor(dst, cv2.COLOR_HSV2BGR, dst=dst)
93 
94  return dst
